scene_descriptions.description: New system in living room: monetary penalties for boundary violations. Almost 10 dollars deposited by evening. Wants to post story about regret but is

scene_descriptions.name: The Disclosure Fantasy
scene_descriptions.description: Considering posting the old picture publicly. Everyone would know - no longer living stealthily. "Imagining this makes me feel both lighter and free."

scene_descriptions.description: Not tired, but can't find a reason to start the day. The recognition: "It's not healthy how I deposit unto other people my daily drive."

scene_descriptions.description: Memory surfacing: high school bench where she'd play the odds to see her pass by. College: waiting in cars, chatting until early morning on phones.

scene_descriptions.description: Tracing the pattern: childhood to Monica, overlap with Catherine, transition with Catherine still there, Las Vegas in July, six months single, Sonny.

scene_descriptions.description: Colleague notices her silence, asks about her life. Fantasy response unspoken: "well, I used to be a dude, and now I am a depressed sexy woman."

scene_descriptions.description: Three women blurring in her mind: one from a shared room, one sharing queerness, one from two dates. "One kiss for each meeting."

scene_descriptions.name: The Last Words Spoken
scene_descriptions.description: Memory of final in-person moment: "I'll give you another one before you go." The flustered mumble about texting. "And now she doesn't."

scene_descriptions.name: Evening Walk with Camera
scene_descriptions.description: Out for alcohol and chips, camera in hand. Two pictures posted, different focus points. The question underneath: "Will Kate like them?"

scene_descriptions.description: "It's not like I showed signs of it. I'm literally experiencing it right now." The painful awareness of pattern while trapped inside it.

scene_descriptions.description: Interrogating whether this desperation is masculine socialization—the false belief of deserving whatever one wants, of being the protagonist.

scene_descriptions.description: Sending friend the short-haired photo, discussing the temptation to post it, imagining various reactions—who would ask "Who's that?" and how to answer

scene_descriptions.description: The intuition that posting the pre-transition photo would mean "forfeiting that option forever" with Kate—though uncertain the option even exists.

scene_descriptions.name: Jules' Therapy Quote
scene_descriptions.description: The Euphoria line crystallizes everything: "I fall in love so easily because half of the relationship is in my head."

scene_descriptions.name: Confession to Alda
scene_descriptions.description: Admitting the compulsion to post meaningless stories just to check if Kate sees them. "I am not in her mind. Not even close to how she's in mine."

scene_descriptions.name: Message into the Void
scene_descriptions.description: Sending a message to Helena knowing it will probably be ignored; questioning if she's even accepting of trans people.

scene_descriptions.name: Wanting Touch
scene_descriptions.description: The desire for Kate isn't sight or sex alone—it's touch, kissing. She turned down a hookup opportunity. The bridge is burnt by wanting too much.

scene_descriptions.name: Pizza and Surrender
scene_descriptions.description: Ordering pizza because she doesn't feel like cooking or doing anything. The day ends in small defeat.

scene_descriptions.name: The Fuckboi Countdown
scene_descriptions.description: Epigraph from roommate's joke about the one-month dignity challenge. Dark humor framing what follows.

scene_descriptions.description: Living room, two women at laptops. Adderall, relaxant, weed combined. "Mixing our uppers with our downers." Overfocus, distraction, the ADHD question.

scene_descriptions.name: Nothing to Check
scene_descriptions.description: Phone on table, no story posted. The weird emptiness of having nothing to refresh. Glancing compulsively anyway.

scene_descriptions.name: 1 AM Surveillance
scene_descriptions.description: She was online, posted a story. Painting her roommate's eyes. A comment sent. Seen in the morning, no reply.

scene_descriptions.name: Reverse Chronology of Shame

scene_descriptions.name: The Stench of Masculinity
scene_descriptions.description: The third-text as source of the stench. "The masculine energy that has impregnated all this recounting."

scene_descriptions.description: She lowers the skin before warning. Fear when it's hard to get back up. "I would not want to look for an ER with an inflamed glans as a woman."

scene_descriptions.name: Sexting from the Void
scene_descriptions.description: Emily's messages on screen demanding nakedness. The narrator's confession: "Why do you have this power over me?" The dynamic of digital submission.

scene_descriptions.name: 4 AM Coat Delivery
scene_descriptions.description: Post-bar logistics cascade: Ubers cancelling, walking halfway to McGill in the cold. Meeting at 4 AM after the time change to deliver a coat.

scene_descriptions.name: The Bathroom Stall
scene_descriptions.description: Watching Gabriela take Alda's hand for shots. The dangerous mixture: invisible, left-out, jealous. Retreating to a stall to hide from thoughts. Emily'

scene_descriptions.name: The Signal
scene_descriptions.description: Dancing with Gabriela when Nico signals a four. Arms grabbed. The attempted four-way kiss. Alda moving away at first. "The most gay thing I can think

scene_descriptions.name: The Guess
scene_descriptions.description: Friends guess Gabriela's age as 20. The sting of discomfort. No excuse of horniness—new medications, recent sex. "Maybe it's just the shitty parts wit

scene_descriptions.name: French Girl Detour
scene_descriptions.description: Hinge conversation with the evil-twin caption. A week-long delay. The discovery: South West France. "Oh wait, are you French?" "Yes I am." Expecting s

scene_descriptions.name: The Unfollow
scene_descriptions.description: Kate removed from Instagram. A small act of severance in the stream of the night.

scene_descriptions.name: The Undone Homework
scene_descriptions.description: Interior reflection on tomorrow's psychiatrist appointment. The homework was not completed—only the books were downloaded, the list glanced at. A fami

scene_descriptions.name: The Missing Form
scene_descriptions.description: The OSD form was never sent back. A plan forms to ask about it, a small task deferred.

scene_descriptions.name: The Unanswered Question
scene_descriptions.description: The entry trails off with "How have I been feeling with the new medication?" The silence after the question speaks louder than any answer.

scene_descriptions.name: The Proposition
scene_descriptions.description: Opening text message about empty app conversations going nowhere, the invitation to meet in person, the offer to pay.

scene_descriptions.name: Night Walk Home
scene_descriptions.description: Coming home from the date, stopping at the dépanneur for beer and chips, the solitary ritual after romantic encounter.

scene_descriptions.name: The Empty Restaurant
scene_descriptions.description: Passing the Indian restaurant, seeing a man alone through the window, the memory of a previous date surfacing, stepping back to look again.

scene_descriptions.name: The Greek Alphabet
scene_descriptions.description: Mental cataloging of dates: Alfa (knew own feelings, not hers), Beta (mutual mystery), Gamma/tonight (no attraction, her feelings unknown).

scene_descriptions.name: Instant Investment
scene_descriptions.description: The moment of recognition at the café table: something in the narrator gets invested regardless of actual desire. The pattern named.

scene_descriptions.name: Time Lost
scene_descriptions.description: Mid-date discovery that two and a half hours have passed. The conversation flowing despite internal certainty it would die.

scene_descriptions.name: The Meta-Question
scene_descriptions.description: Writing in the journal about writing in the journal. The obsessive focus turned back on itself.

scene_descriptions.name: Bumble BFF
scene_descriptions.description: Working on friendship profiles with a roommate, discussing the possibility of platonic connection. "Since there's no possibility of having sex, what's

scene_descriptions.name: The Message Sent
scene_descriptions.description: Planning what to tell the roommate about ending the French fixation joke. Instead, typing the message previously resolved not to send. Compulsion wins

scene_descriptions.name: Reflection on Writing
scene_descriptions.description: Alone, the narrator observes the correlation between feeling better and writing less; confused about which day she told a friend about emails, noting

scene_descriptions.name: Committee Meeting Afterglow
scene_descriptions.description: Memory of Monday's positive meeting; they liked the project, gave good feedback. Her supervisor promoted her software, told her half-jokingly she wasn

scene_descriptions.name: Cat Cafe with Alex
scene_descriptions.description: Finally visiting the cat cafe she once almost visited in the rain with someone else. Cute cats but awkward silences when the whole place goes quiet an

scene_descriptions.name: Digital Severance
scene_descriptions.description: Removing an ex as follower so she doesn't see stories or pictures. "Do I regret it? No, it's better to don't fool myself into false hope."

scene_descriptions.name: Morning Message
scene_descriptions.description: Waking to an unexpected WhatsApp message from a friend; just yesterday she'd been thinking about messaging her while walking from the metro, decided a

scene_descriptions.name: Planning Tomorrow's Date
scene_descriptions.description: Meeting a physicist named like her ex at Place-des-Arts; she's vegetarian. The narrator recalls nachos at the same restaurant with a friend.

scene_descriptions.name: Six Hours Unfolding
scene_descriptions.description: Met at 3pm, walked toward campus at 9pm. The arc: cafe, Uber to Crescent Street, a bar down the block.

scene_descriptions.name: The Kiss Request
scene_descriptions.description: Waiting for the shuttle; she mentions the skirt, says she looks cute but must be cold. Both still masked when she asks "can I kiss you?"

scene_descriptions.name: Synesthetic Touch
scene_descriptions.description: "I put my hand behind her neck instead of on her cheek. I played with two locks of curls, and it was as if I could feel their yellow in my fingertips.

scene_descriptions.name: Safe Arrival
scene_descriptions.description: She asks her to text that she arrived well. She did.

scene_descriptions.name: The Epigraph
scene_descriptions.description: Opening confession about hesitation to kiss after a past rejection: "Haven't gotten over it, honestly."

scene_descriptions.name: Dressing for the Date
scene_descriptions.description: Heeled boots, black skirt, 5 degrees outside. Rehearsing deflections in her head for why she dressed up when she couldn't wear makeup or shave.

scene_descriptions.name: The Laser Clinic
scene_descriptions.description: Paying for treatment, so high she nearly tipped $150 to the doctor.

scene_descriptions.name: The Long Wait
scene_descriptions.description: An hour late. Parking troubles. Growing cold. Ordering a latte alone while texts trickle in about reserved spots.

scene_descriptions.name: The Flaw-Seeking
scene_descriptions.description: The mask comes off across the table. "I was barely conscious of how my head was busy looking for flaws or manners that I would find unattractive."

scene_descriptions.name: The Intoxicating Accent
scene_descriptions.description: French inflection triggers comparison, then fear: following the same fate of ghosting and fixation.

scene_descriptions.name: Quantum Physics and Forgotten Hunger
scene_descriptions.description: She talks, the narrator listens. No food ordered because the conversation about qubits is too absorbing.

scene_descriptions.name: The Expectations Talk
scene_descriptions.description: Walking outside, asking what she wants since she's leaving the country. Not the one-night-stand type.

scene_descriptions.name: The Hug
scene_descriptions.description: End of the date. "Can I give you a hug?" Hesitation about COVID, then open arms.

scene_descriptions.name: Phone Facing Down
scene_descriptions.description: Walking home, texting multiple women. The phone turned over: performing indifference to whether anyone responds.

scene_descriptions.name: The Smile Erased
scene_descriptions.description: Telling the roommate about the French girl's message; smiling at the notification with her name; reading the second half where she's rejected. The roo

scene_descriptions.name: Pure Sadness, Discovered
scene_descriptions.description: In Spanish conversation, confessing the hurt is real this time. "No es por hormonas o depresion, o el vacio existencial de siempre. Es pura tristeza.

scene_descriptions.name: The Accusation
scene_descriptions.description: "*Te gusta que te digan que no.*" The friend names the pattern. The narrator half-agrees, half-resists.

scene_descriptions.name: Mother Echo
scene_descriptions.description: Melissa's email about a patient's mother dying. The intrusive thought: "My mother is dead, and everything is worse now."

scene_descriptions.name: Planning Alexandra
scene_descriptions.description: Texting to plan Friday. She chooses here over the theater—cozy. The roommates will be gone. The unspoken expectation of sex.

scene_descriptions.name: Salome Returns
scene_descriptions.description: A message after two weeks of silence. Despite needing to cut back on dates and expenses, she says yes. Wednesday in Vieux Port.

scene_descriptions.name: The Deadline
scene_descriptions.description: Automatic email from IPN. Candidacy exam before April 30th or it's a Fail. Drafting emails to Louis and Boris, academic survival layered over emotiona

scene_descriptions.name: The Proposal Text
scene_descriptions.description: Epigraph: A date invitation to walk up the mountain at sunset, met with acceptance—followed by eventual rejection. The bitter irony of "That sounds ni

scene_descriptions.name: Doodle Poll Anxiety
scene_descriptions.description: At home, the narrator manages committee scheduling. Email sent, waiting for responses. Only one option works. Frustration building as people don't rep

scene_descriptions.name: The Pool and Sauna
scene_descriptions.description: Swimming before an appointment. Body in water, then in heat. Stomach troubles—gassy but unable to relieve. The body's discomfort.

scene_descriptions.name: The Contract Moment
scene_descriptions.description: At the laser hair removal clinic. They overcharge without accounting for the previous tip—she says nothing. Then: turning over the contract, seeing "M

scene_descriptions.name: Dating Inventory
scene_descriptions.description: Narrator alone, cataloguing prospects. One texted and hopes won't reply. One has a reservation but "I feel nothing." One is coming to visit—the last w

scene_descriptions.name: The Sensory Memory
scene_descriptions.description: Memory surfaces: "I liked her taste and how it hurt when she pressed hard on my back and bit my neck." Physical intimacy recalled with visceral precis

scene_descriptions.name: The Disclosure Resolution
scene_descriptions.description: Thinking through the pattern of rejection. "Why did it have to be like Flore?" The same vanishing act. Deciding to disclose trans status before meetin

scene_descriptions.name: The Email Exchange
scene_descriptions.description: Reading a mother's response about photography and potential second dates. The urge to reply about the rejection, about being broken. Choosing silence

events.name: I Forgot If It Was My Turn

scene_descriptions.name: Next Week Proposal
scene_descriptions.description: Opening quote: invitation to her place before roommates arrive. Future possibility.

scene_descriptions.name: The Return Kiss
scene_descriptions.description: Bus station goodbye. She walks away, turns back: "I'll kiss you again before leaving." The anxiety that it meant finality.

events.name: She Lifted Her Face And I Met

scene_descriptions.name: Candidacy Confirmed
scene_descriptions.description: Email exchange with Louis. Sylvia says yes. May 17th locked in. The Learning Support guy question lingers.

scene_descriptions.name: Friday Postponed
scene_descriptions.description: Text negotiation. Lab exhaustion. The choice between 9pm Friday or Sunday here. Chose Sunday.

scene_descriptions.name: Saturday Nothing
scene_descriptions.description: Single sentence fragment: "Saturday I did nothing."

scene_descriptions.name: Mamajuana Evening
scene_descriptions.description: Balcony with roommate, returning to laptops, two glasses of Dominican rum-infused drink. Writing interrupted: "What was I writing about?"

scene_descriptions.name: Film Log in the Park
scene_descriptions.description: Waiting outside to bring her in. Distracted by a plant across the park. Trying to remember aperture and speed. Hearing her name.

scene_descriptions.name: The Blanket Request
scene_descriptions.description: During The Worst Person in the World, she asks for a blanket. Ambiguity: cold or proximity-seeking?

scene_descriptions.name: Breathing Confusion
scene_descriptions.description: The House, second fragment. Her arm wrapped around. Head on shoulder. "I, for a moment, forgot if it was my turn to inhale or exhale."

scene_descriptions.name: First Kiss
scene_descriptions.description: Hair comment, small laughs of uncertain meaning. "She lifted her face and I met her lips."

scene_descriptions.name: After the Movie
scene_descriptions.description: Uncertainty whether she'll stay or leave. Kissing again. Neck. "Felt each of the fingers in her hand wrapping my breast."

scene_descriptions.name: Amanda Message
scene_descriptions.description: Text about sunset walk Wednesday. Conditional: "If she doesn't answer back, then it won't."

scene_descriptions.name: Supervisor Disclosure
scene_descriptions.description: Morning meeting with Eduardo. Telling him about bipolar, time management difficulties. He was understanding.

scene_descriptions.name: Garden Growth
scene_descriptions.description: Balcony with roommate: "it all started with one dying plant, and now we have our own full garden."

scene_descriptions.name: Epigraph: Ghosting Prophecy
scene_descriptions.description: "Do you want to get coffee and at least put a face to the person we're gonna potentially end up ghosting anyway?"

scene_descriptions.name: The Walk
scene_descriptions.description: 18km to Mont-Royal; thought it was cute and original; she'd done it with five others before. She grabs the narrator's arm at the belvedere. No kiss up

scene_descriptions.name: Camera Trouble
scene_descriptions.description: Shutter getting stuck; took roll out to fix; sat at a table listening to music, waiting.

scene_descriptions.name: The Compatibility Test
scene_descriptions.description: "I'll tell you some things and just tell me if you like them or not... trying to see what else we can do later."

scene_descriptions.name: The Kiss
scene_descriptions.description: She buys the donut. When leaving, "I asked her if I could kiss her."

scene_descriptions.name: The Friend Request
scene_descriptions.description: Sent Facebook friend request and immediately regretted; Flore rejection memory surfaces.

scene_descriptions.name: The Departure
scene_descriptions.description: Phone dead, show cancelled, find her on Facebook. Won't see her until August—if ever.

scene_descriptions.name: Unanswered Messages
scene_descriptions.description: Two messages sent, both ignored. "Is it the threat of abandonment that aches more than the rejection itself?"

scene_descriptions.name: Therapy Session
scene_descriptions.description: "I feel as if I'm distracting myself with these women, but from what?"

scene_descriptions.name: The Core Question
scene_descriptions.description: Drinking alone. "What is it with me that I am so easy to ignore?"

scene_descriptions.name: Famished for Attention
scene_descriptions.description: Posted on Instagram a picture without a bra. "I guess I am famished for attention."

scene_descriptions.name: Freedom Epigraph
scene_descriptions.description: Opening quote dialogue: "Your mother will let you go out alone. You will be free." "Being free is being alone?"

scene_descriptions.name: The Missing Month
scene_descriptions.description: Acknowledging the gap in writing; sent emails to Monica and Melissa, regretted it on the walk home; imagining Monica rolling her eyes.

scene_descriptions.name: Therapy Mind-Reading
scene_descriptions.description: Oren (second therapist, "whom I was cheating Calli with") would point out the mind-reading pattern.

scene_descriptions.description: Her departure didn't break like others' silence. Trying to fill the void with meaningless encounters. Alda's sharp response about "being slutty with j

scene_descriptions.name: Rooftop Party
scene_descriptions.description: Leaving for Ellelui's rooftop lesbian party; the stolen tripod noticed as they depart. Alda kissing a girl from the apps she didn't like.

scene_descriptions.name: The Dating Calendar
scene_descriptions.description: Multiple dates stacked: Tuesday, tomorrow with a French woman from Paris, scheduling with Jessica for Petite maman. "Why do I keep doing this to mysel

scene_descriptions.name: Wine and No Food
scene_descriptions.description: Haven't eaten all day; latte for breakfast, half a bottle of wine for dinner.

scene_descriptions.name: The Reversal Insight
scene_descriptions.description: Alcohol not to control overwhelming feelings but to "lose down the emotional block"—accessing emotions rather than numbing them.

scene_descriptions.name: Chappelle on TV
scene_descriptions.description: Alda starts watching Dave Chappelle's show; the urge to comment instead of simply disclosing: "Hey, do you know I am trans?"

scene_descriptions.name: Practice Dating
scene_descriptions.description: The question surfaces: "Am I using these girls as practice?" Oren's advice to focus on breath, but: "I don't feel like doing even that."

scene_descriptions.description: Spanish epigraph as interior monologue: a void swallowing from inside, the self reduced to tissue and bone.

scene_descriptions.description: Narrator uncertain how long since last entry. Time slipping by, approaching 30, the verdict: failure.

scene_descriptions.description: Session with Oren ending; narrator admits lying about insurance email; the transaction of mental health care.

scene_descriptions.description: Writing to Monica: "I am lost." Thoughts muted. An explosion in throat driving to tears.

scene_descriptions.description: Bathroom moment: razor against thigh, a red streak appearing. The word "unintentional" recognized immediately as a lie. Half-intentions, empty promise

scene_descriptions.name: The Vodka Dinner
scene_descriptions.description: Groceries delayed again; vodka as joke-threat for dinner. The question: self-medication or liberation from judgment?

scene_descriptions.name: The Final Deletion
scene_descriptions.description: Dating apps removed again. No pretense this time of permanence—"I have just had enough."

scene_descriptions.name: The Overnight Guest
scene_descriptions.description: Héloïse stays the night. Outside the dépanneur, Nico asks if one-night-stand. She cried on the bed, face contorted, snot dripping.

scene_descriptions.name: The Overstay
scene_descriptions.description: Morning after: she wears narrator's clothes, speaks French to bank and employers. Texting Alda about kicking her out.

scene_descriptions.name: The Porcelain Speech
scene_descriptions.description: Night before: she rejects the "no intentions" caveat for sharing the bed. "If I wanted to have sex with her, I could just make my move." Her argument

scene_descriptions.description: Considering asking if she was disappointed or relieved by lack of moves. The question driven by Jessica's soft rejection. Either answer confirms somet

scene_descriptions.name: The Ominous Beginning
scene_descriptions.description: Starting journal on day two of the month. The failure feels predetermined.

scene_descriptions.name: Wine That Tastes Like Vinegar
scene_descriptions.description: Wine and salad, the irony of healthy eating and weight gain. The vinegar taste lingers like the shitty dressing.

scene_descriptions.name: The Confession
scene_descriptions.description: Craving wine to mute feelings. The contradiction: wanting emotional connection in therapy while shutting down at the first signal.

scene_descriptions.name: The Shrooms Revelation
scene_descriptions.description: Memory of psychedelic trip. The insight: dating is "a desperate try to convince myself I am desirable. A non-awful non-unlovable person."

scene_descriptions.name: The Therapist's Reprimand
scene_descriptions.description: Flashback to sessions with René. Missing the free-flowing talk, then the memory of being told she wasted time on inconsequential stuff.

scene_descriptions.name: Mother's Voice
scene_descriptions.description: The echo surfaces. "Very similar to how my mom would scold me about pretending to be an idiot." The question: unconscious defenses or actual idiocy?

scene_descriptions.name: The Insurance Email
scene_descriptions.description: Expected $150, received less than $50. Only hormones covered. The scheduled email that had to be sent manually by noon.

scene_descriptions.name: The Lease Conversation
scene_descriptions.description: Yesterday at Thomson House. Planning to move with Alda, discussing how to tell Jose Luis. "I did not care, even though, were I in his place, I would d

scene_descriptions.name: The Unanswered Texts
scene_descriptions.description: The med student who said "please text me again" and never responded. The latest French girl texted.

scene_descriptions.description: Final question. "Do I even want to meet any of them? What the fuck is it that I want?"
